meanings.definition: A place where clothes and linens are washed and dried using coin-operated machines.
meanings.sent1: I need to go to the laundromat to wash my dirty clothes.
meanings.sent2: My mom goes to the laundromat every Saturday to do the laundry.
meanings.sent3: The laundromat is like a magical place where clothes get clean with the help of machines.
meanings.sent4: The laundromat is a busy hive of activity, with clothes spinning and tumbling in the machines.
meanings.sent5: The neon sign of the laundromat glowed brightly, beckoning customers to come inside and wash their clothes.

meanings.definition: The act of washing and drying clothes and linens at a laundromat.
meanings.sent1: Doing the laundromat is not my favorite chore, but it needs to be done.
meanings.sent2: She finds solace in the routine of laundromat every week.
meanings.sent3: I turned doing the laundromat into a fun game by timing the cycles on the machines.
meanings.sent4: The laundromat became my sanctuary, where I could escape the chaos of daily life.
meanings.sent5: The sound of clothes tumbling in the laundromat was oddly soothing, like a lullaby for grown-ups.
